verses.verse: Then Job <S%H347><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%>
I know <S%H3045><s%> it is so <S%H3588><s%> <S%H3651><s%> of a truth: <S%H551><s%> but how <S%H4100><s%> should man <S%H582><s%> be just <S%H6663><s%> with <S%H5973><s%> God? <S%H410><s%>
If <S%H518><s%> he will <S%H2654><s%> contend <S%H7378><s%> with <S%H5973><s%> him, he cannot <S%H3808><s%> answer <S%H6030><s%> him one <S%H259><s%> of <S%H4480><s%> a thousand. <S%H505><s%>

He is wise <S%H2450><s%> in heart, <S%H3824><s%> and mighty <S%H533><s%> in strength: <S%H3581><s%> who <S%H4310><s%> hath hardened <S%H7185><s%> himself against <S%H413><s%> him, and hath prospered? <S%H7999><s%>
Which removeth <S%H6275><s%> the mountains, <S%H2022><s%> and they know <S%H3045><s%> not: <S%H3808><s%> which <S%H834><s%> overturneth <S%H2015><s%> them in his anger. <S%H639><s%>
Which shaketh <S%H7264><s%> the earth <S%H776><s%> out of her place, <S%H4480><s%> <S%H4725><s%> and the pillars <S%H5982><s%> thereof tremble. <S%H6426><s%>
Which commandeth <S%H559><s%> the sun, <S%H2775><s%> and it riseth <S%H2224><s%> not; <S%H3808><s%> and sealeth up <S%H2856><s%> the stars. <S%H3556><s%>
Which alone <S%H905><s%> spreadeth out <S%H5186><s%> the heavens, <S%H8064><s%> and treadeth <S%H1869><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> the waves <S%H1116><s%> of the sea. <S%H3220><s%>
Which maketh <S%H6213><s%> Arcturus, <S%H5906><s%> Orion, <S%H3685><s%> and Pleiades, <S%H3598><s%> and the chambers <S%H2315><s%> of the south. <S%H8486><s%>
Which doeth <S%H6213><s%> great things <S%H1419><s%> past <S%H5704><s%> <S%H369><s%> finding out; <S%H2714><s%> yea, and wonders <S%H6381><s%> without <S%H5704><s%> <S%H369><s%> number. <S%H4557><s%>
Lo, <S%H2005><s%> he goeth <S%H5674><s%> by <S%H5921><s%> me, and I see <S%H7200><s%> him not: <S%H3808><s%> he passeth on <S%H2498><s%> also, but I perceive <S%H995><s%> him not. <S%H3808><s%>

Behold, <S%H2005><s%> he taketh away, <S%H2862><s%> who <S%H4310><s%> can hinder <S%H7725><s%> him? who <S%H4310><s%> will say <S%H559><s%> unto <S%H413><s%> him, What <S%H4100><s%> doest <S%H6213><s%> thou?
If God <S%H433><s%> will not <S%H3808><s%> withdraw <S%H7725><s%> his anger, <S%H639><s%> the proud <S%H7295><s%> helpers <S%H5826><s%> do stoop <S%H7817><s%> under <S%H8478><s%> him.
How much less <S%H637><s%> <S%H3588><s%> shall I <S%H595><s%> answer <S%H6030><s%> him, and choose out <S%H977><s%> my words <S%H1697><s%> to reason with <S%H5973><s%> him?
Whom, <S%H834><s%> though <S%H518><s%> I were righteous, <S%H6663><s%> yet would I not <S%H3808><s%> answer, <S%H6030><s%> but I would make supplication <S%H2603><s%> to my judge. <S%H8199><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> I had called, <S%H7121><s%> and he had answered <S%H6030><s%> me; yet would I not <S%H3808><s%> believe <S%H539><s%> that <S%H3588><s%> he had hearkened <S%H238><s%> unto my voice. <S%H6963><s%>
For <S%H834><s%> he breaketh <S%H7779><s%> me with a tempest, <S%H8183><s%> and multiplieth <S%H7235><s%> my wounds <S%H6482><s%> without cause. <S%H2600><s%>
He will not <S%H3808><s%> suffer <S%H5414><s%> me to take <S%H7725><s%> my breath, <S%H7307><s%> but <S%H3588><s%> filleth <S%H7646><s%> me with bitterness. <S%H4472><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> I speak of strength, <S%H3581><s%> lo, <S%H2009><s%> he is strong: <S%H533><s%> and if <S%H518><s%> of judgment, <S%H4941><s%> who <S%H4310><s%> shall set me a time <S%H3259><s%> to plead?

If <S%H518><s%> I justify <S%H6663><s%> myself, mine own mouth <S%H6310><s%> shall condemn <S%H7561><s%> me: if I say, I <S%H589><s%> am perfect, <S%H8535><s%> it shall also prove me perverse. <S%H6140><s%>
Though I <S%H589><s%> were perfect, <S%H8535><s%> yet would I not <S%H3808><s%> know <S%H3045><s%> my soul: <S%H5315><s%> I would despise <S%H3988><s%> my life. <S%H2416><s%>

This <S%H1931><s%> is one <S%H259><s%> thing, therefore <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3651><s%> I said <S%H559><s%> it, He <S%H1931><s%> destroyeth <S%H3615><s%> the perfect <S%H8535><s%> and the wicked. <S%H7563><s%>
If <S%H518><s%> the scourge <S%H7752><s%> slay <S%H4191><s%> suddenly, <S%H6597><s%> he will laugh <S%H3932><s%> at the trial <S%H4531><s%> of the innocent. <S%H5355><s%>

The earth <S%H776><s%> is given <S%H5414><s%> into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of the wicked: <S%H7563><s%> he covereth <S%H3680><s%> the faces <S%H6440><s%> of the judges <S%H8199><s%> thereof; if <S%H518><s%> not, <S%H3808><s%> where, <S%H645><s%> and who <S%H4310><s%> is he? <S%H1931><s%>
Now my days <S%H3117><s%> are swifter <S%H7043><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> a post: <S%H7323><s%> they flee away, <S%H1272><s%> they see <S%H7200><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> good. <S%H2896><s%>
They are passed away <S%H2498><s%> as <S%H5973><s%> the swift <S%H16><s%> ships: <S%H591><s%> as the eagle <S%H5404><s%> that hasteth <S%H2907><s%> to <S%H5921><s%> the prey. <S%H400><s%>
If <S%H518><s%> I say, <S%H559><s%> I will forget <S%H7911><s%> my complaint, <S%H7879><s%> I will leave off <S%H5800><s%> my heaviness, <S%H6440><s%> and comfort <S%H1082><s%> myself:
I am afraid <S%H3025><s%> of all <S%H3605><s%> my sorrows, <S%H6094><s%> I know <S%H3045><s%> that <S%H3588><s%> thou wilt not <S%H3808><s%> hold me innocent. <S%H5352><s%>
If I <S%H595><s%> be wicked, <S%H7561><s%> why <S%H4100><s%> then <S%H2088><s%> labor <S%H3021><s%> I in vain? <S%H1892><s%>
If <S%H518><s%> I wash myself <S%H7364><s%> with snow <S%H7950><s%> water, <S%H4325><s%> and make my hands <S%H3709><s%> never <S%H1253><s%> so clean; <S%H2141><s%>
Yet <S%H227><s%> shalt thou plunge <S%H2881><s%> me in the ditch, <S%H7845><s%> and mine own clothes <S%H8008><s%> shall abhor <S%H8581><s%> me.

For <S%H3588><s%> he is not <S%H3808><s%> a man, <S%H376><s%> as I <S%H3644><s%> am, that I should answer <S%H6030><s%> him, and we should come <S%H935><s%> together <S%H3162><s%> in judgment. <S%H4941><s%>
Neither <S%H3808><s%> is there <S%H3426><s%> any daysman <S%H3198><s%> between <S%H996><s%> us, that might lay <S%H7896><s%> his hand <S%H3027><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> us both. <S%H8147><s%>
Let him take his rod away <S%H5493><s%> <S%H7626><s%> from <S%H4480><s%> <S%H5921><s%> me, and let not <S%H408><s%> his fear <S%H367><s%> terrify <S%H1204><s%> me:
Then would I speak, <S%H1696><s%> and not <S%H3808><s%> fear <S%H3372><s%> him; but <S%H3588><s%> it is not <S%H3808><s%> so <S%H3651><s%> with <S%H5978><s%> me.
